2.text: Warm your filet mignon steaks on your counter top for about 30 minutes.

3.text: Season your steak with salt and pepper.

4.text: Heat 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.

5.text: Place the steaks in the hot skillet and cook for 4 minutes.

6.text: Flip the steaks over and cook the top side for 4 minutes.

7.text: Put the steaks on a baking sheet and transfer them to the oven.

8.text: Bake the steaks for 5-8 minutes based on doneness.

9.text: Remove the steaks from the oven and let them cool for 5-7 minutes.

10.text: Serve filet mignon with its juices for a simple, delicious flavor.

11.text: Top the steaks with herb butter for a stronger seasoning.

12.text: Pair cooked vegetables or mashed potatoes with filet mignon as a side.

13.text: Store your filet mignon leftovers in the fridge for 3-4 days at a time.
